definition: dishonest practices
to sprain (one's ankle) (Tw)
askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
old variant of 邪[xie2]
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Do not think that I am a lover of crooked ways.
sentences.chinese: 别以为我喜欢这些歪门邪道。

sentences.english: Let's get our minds out of the gutter while discussing this matter.
sentences.chinese: 当讨论这件事，我们不可有歪门邪道的念头。

sentences.english: Don't take crooked ways to solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 不要用歪门邪道解决这个问题。

sentences.english: Or should I call it "Perverts and statues"?
sentences.chinese: 或者可以称为“歪门邪道的人和雕像”？
有时广告也走歪门邪道。

to swindle/to cheat
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
see 邪道[xie2 dao4]
riffraff/scum/lowlife/despicable/inferior
illegal device/devious/crooked

(coll.) unorthodox (method etc)
everything in disorder (idiom)/in a hideous mess/obscene/dirty/filthy
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others
to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
swindler/itinerant con-man
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
